question: What is the purpose of the track tag, and when should it be used?
incorrectAnswers: The track tag is used for specifying subtitles. It is typically applied as a child of the audio and video tags.
The track tag is used for specifying subtitles. It is typically applied as a child of the video tag.
The track tag is used for specifying subtitles, captions, and other types of time-based text. It is typically applied as a child of the video tag.
correctAnswer: The track tag is used for specifying subtitles, captions, and other types of time-based text. It is typically applied as a child of the audio and video tag.

question: When is the link tag used?
incorrectAnswers: when linking style sheets, JavaScript, and icons for mobile apps
when linking style sheets, favicons, and preloading assets
when linking style sheets, external URLs, and favicons
correctAnswer: when linking style sheets and favicons

question: The value attribute is associated with which set of tags?
incorrectAnswers: button,input,form
input,label,meter
input,option,textarea

question: When should you use the aside element?
incorrectAnswers: for anything you want to move to the side, like a pull quote box, a sidebar, or an image with text wrapping around it
for anything in parentheses
for anything in a sidebar
correctAnswer: when the content can be removed without detracting from the pages message

question: With which tags is the source element associated?
incorrectAnswers: svg, picture, audio, and video
It is interchangeable with the src attribute, so any element which uses src may use source
audio and video

question: When should you use ol and ul elements?
incorrectAnswers: Use ul when you have a list of items in which the order of the items matters. Use ol when you have a list of items that could go in any order.
Use ol when you want a bulleted list and ul when you want a numbered list.
Use ol when you have a list of items in which the order of the items matters. Use ul when you have a list of items that could go in any order.
correctAnswer: Use ul when you want a bulleted list and ol when you want a numbered list.

question: What is the difference between the div and span tags?
incorrectAnswers: div is used for major divisions on a page, while span is used to span across columns.
div is the industry-standard default tag, but you could use span if you prefer.
div is used where a generic inline tag is needed, while span is used where a generic block-level tag is needed.
correctAnswer: div is used where a generic block-level tag is needed, while span is used where a generic inline tag is needed.

question: What is the hr tag typically used for?
incorrectAnswers: This tag is depreciated and should not be used.
It draws a horizontal line.
It designates a shift of topic at the section level.
correctAnswer: It designates a topic shift within a section at the paragraph level.

question: To get a link to open in a new window or tab
incorrectAnswers: _self
_new
_parent

question: What does the poster attribute do in the video tag?
incorrectAnswers: It specifies an image that only displays if there is a problem with the video.
It specifies an image that should display until the video is played.
It specifies an image that should display while the video downloads.
correctAnswer: It specifies an image that should display while the video downloads and until the video is played.

question: What is the primary purpose of the canvas tag?
incorrectAnswers: It allows raster images to be rendered on the webpage.
It displays annotated images.
It allows vector images to be rendered on the webpage.
correctAnswer: It allows drawing on a bitmap via JavaScript.

question: Which choice contains three valid block-level elements?
incorrectAnswers: details, abbr, figcaption
canvas, select, noscript
kbd, p, main

question: Which image formats can be displayed by all web browsers?
incorrectAnswers: JPG, GIF, TIF
JPG, TIF, BMP
TIF, BMP, GIF

question: You want to have single spacing in between some lines, like in a poem or an address. Which approach should you use?
incorrectAnswers: Wrap the text in a box that is the right width so everything wraps correctly. Set the box width with CSS.
Use the pre tag to make the line spacing look exactly like you want.
Separate the lines with the br tag.
correctAnswer: Separate lines with a p, then use CSS to make single spacing.

question: What does the wbr tag do?
incorrectAnswers: It requires the browser to wrap the current line at that point.
It breaks a word into two pieces, using a hyphen to connect the words.
It formats a sentence to be easily breakable.
correctAnswer: It presents an opportunity for a break in a very long word, if needed for proper page display.

question: Which statement is false?
incorrectAnswers: Inline elements can be nested inside inline elements.
Block elements can be nested inside block elements.
Inline elements can be nested inside block elements.
correctAnswer: Block elements can be nested inside inline elements.
